Description: Phase 0: Project Setup and Spikes — Unity project creation, CI pipeline, 3 technical spikes (external display, video pipeline, drawing latency), team standards. Unity 6 LTS project with URP + Android config. GitHub + Git LFS + CI pipeline. Coding standards + folder structure + assembly defs. Initial adaptive icon from logo #1.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Unity 6 LTS project with URP configured for Android committed to GitHub with Git LFS
- Working CI pipeline (GitHub Actions) building debug APKs
- Spike results for: external display output, video-to-RenderTexture, and touch drawing latency
- Coding standards document, branching strategy, and Jira board populated
- Initial adaptive icon set generated from Maptifier #1 logo

Summary: Create Unity 6 LTS project with full Android configuration
Description: Create new Unity 6 LTS (2025.3.x) project using URP template. Configure: IL2CPP, ARM64, Vulkan primary + GLES 3.2 fallback, Linear color space, min SDK 29, target SDK 34. Generate and commit initial adaptive icon set from Maptifier #1 logo (foreground + background layers).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Project opens cleanly and builds to APK without errors
- Icon shows correctly on launcher and splash
- Player Settings match spec (IL2CPP, ARM64, Vulkan + GLES 3.2, Linear, SDK 29/34)

Summary: Set up GitHub repo, Git LFS, and GitHub Actions CI
Description: Create private repo maptifier-android with branch protection on main (require PR reviews). Set up .gitignore (Unity standard), Git LFS for *.png, *.jpg, *.mp4, *.fbx, *.asset, *.shader. Configure GitHub Actions to build debug APK on push to develop and upload artifact.
Acceptance Criteria:
- CI passes on first push to develop
- Debug APK artifact is downloadable from Actions
- APK installs and launches on test device
- Branch protection rules active on main

Description: Implement minimal Android Presentation + DisplayManager plugin and C# bridge (NativeDisplayBridge.cs). Test on Samsung S23, Pixel 7, and one Xiaomi device with USB-C HDMI adapter. Document detection latency, supported resolutions, vsync behavior, disconnect handling, and Samsung DeX behavior.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Content appears on external display within 2 seconds of cable plug-in
- Full documentation of results per device/adapter combo in Wiki or README
- DeX behavior documented with recommended handling

Description: Set up VideoPlayer component playing a test 1080p H.264 MP4 to a RenderTexture. Measure decode latency, frame rate, memory usage on mid-range device. Test seek, loop, pause/resume, switching clips. Validate RenderTexture format (ARGB32 vs R8G8B8A8_UNorm) for downstream compositing.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Runs at >= 30 fps on mid-range device
- RenderTexture format compatible with downstream compositing
- Full performance report with measurements

Description: Implement minimal touch to Catmull-Rom spline to GL.Begin/End immediate-mode rendering. Measure touch-to-photon latency (target: under 30 ms perceived). Test EnhancedTouch from new Input System for multi-touch and pressure data availability across devices.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Latency < 30 ms perceived on test devices
- Pressure data availability documented per device
- Velocity-based fallback simulation working

Summary: Create coding standards, folder structure, and assembly definitions
Description: Write coding standards doc covering naming conventions, lean MVC architecture, ScriptableObject events, ServiceLocator as only allowed singleton. Create full folder structure (Assets/_Project/Scripts/Core|Display|Drawing|Effects|Input|Layers|Masking|Media|Projects|UI|Warping, Shaders, Materials, Prefabs, UI, Resources, Addressables, Plugins/Android). Create ServiceLocator.cs stub. Set up assembly definitions for each module.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All devs can reference the standards doc
- Project compiles with zero warnings
- Assembly definitions in place for all modules

Description: Designer delivers dark-theme style guide: color palette (navy/cyan/magenta from logo), typography (system sans-serif), spacing/grid system. Wireframes for primary screens: Canvas View, Layer Panel, Effects Drawer, Project List. Touch target sizes minimum 48dp (prefer 56dp for gloved/dark-room use).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Style guide approved by Product Owner
- Wireframes for all primary screens delivered
- Imported into Figma project

Description: QA creates device matrix spreadsheet (OEM, model, SoC, Android version, USB-C alt-mode support, screen size). Set up Firebase Crashlytics and Firebase Analytics SDKs in Unity project. Install debug APKs from CI on all test devices.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Spreadsheet shared with team
- Firebase project linked in Unity
- Crashlytics and Analytics verified on at least one device

Description: Phase 1: Infrastructure and External Display — Production-quality external display pipeline, input system foundation, base URP rendering loop, and base UI shell. Robust external display detection, connection, resolution negotiation, hot-plug support, and clean output. Input system with gesture recognizers. Dark-themed UI shell.
Acceptance Criteria:
- External display connects and shows content within 2 seconds of cable plug-in
- Hot-plug 20 times without crash or leak
- Preview on phone matches external output (aspect-ratio corrected)
- Gesture system correctly differentiates tap/drag/pinch/rotate
- Frame rate: 60 fps with static RenderTexture output

Summary: Implement production DisplayService with hot-plug support
Description: Refactor spike code into production DisplayService: IDisplayService interface with OnDisplayConnected/OnDisplayDisconnected/OnResolutionChanged events. AndroidDisplayService implementation using DisplayManager.DisplayListener. EditorDisplayService mock for in-editor testing. Resolution negotiation via Display.getSupportedModes(). Handle cable disconnect, app backgrounding, app resume, display resolution change. Vsync strategy: targetFrameRate=60, vSyncCount=0.
Acceptance Criteria:
- External content renders cleanly on projector
- Phone UI remains private (no UI leak to external)
- Handles unplug/replug gracefully 20+ times without crash
- Resolution negotiated correctly per device
- WakeLock + FLAG_KEEP_SCREEN_ON keeps rendering when screen off

Summary: Set up new Input System + gesture recognizers
Description: Configure New Input System with EnhancedTouch enabled (via EnhancedTouchSupport.Enable()). Build InputService: raw touch tracking (up to 10 touches), gesture recognizer state machine (Idle to Tap/Drag/Pinch/Rotate), gesture events, screen-space to canvas-space coordinate transformer. Implement canvas viewport: pan (two-finger drag), zoom (pinch), with inertia and bounds clamping.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Gestures feel responsive with no conflicts with UI
- Correctly differentiates tap/drag/pinch/rotate with zero false triggers
- Canvas pan/zoom smooth with inertia

Summary: Base URP render loop with CompositeRenderer and ExternalDisplayPass
Description: Create CompositeRenderer: allocate composite RenderTexture matching external display resolution. Blit to phone preview (aspect-ratio letterboxed) AND to external display surface. Implement RenderTexturePool for reusable RT allocation. Set up URP custom ScriptableRendererFeature: CompositePass (blits layer RTs through mixer into composite RT) and ExternalDisplayPass (copies composite RT to external surface with sRGB write-off Material for linear-expecting projectors).
Acceptance Criteria:
- 60 fps target hit on external display with no tearing
- Phone preview matches external output (aspect-ratio corrected)
- No RT leaks after 10 minutes of operation
- Color output correct on projectors expecting linear input

Description: Implement base UI Toolkit layout: top bar (project name, settings gear, display status indicator), center canvas preview area (touch-interactive), bottom tool bar (Select, Warp, Mask, Draw, Effects with 56dp icons), right drawer (layer panel, collapsed by default). Dark theme USS stylesheet matching style guide. Display connection status with real-time indicator and toast notifications.
Acceptance Criteria:
- UI is dark and responsive
- Matches approved style guide
- All touch targets >= 48dp
- Display status indicator shows green/red correctly
- No UI elements visible on external display

Summary: QA: External display device matrix testing
Description: Test external display on all devices in matrix with at least 3 different HDMI adapters. Stress test hot-plug (rapid connect/disconnect). Test with HDMI adapter, USB-C hub, wireless dongle (baseline detection). Log and report resolution negotiation results per device/adapter combo. Verify no UI elements appear on external display.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Test report covering all device/adapter combinations
- All hot-plug tests pass
- Resolution negotiation results documented
- No UI leak to external display confirmed

Description: Phase 2: Core Mapping Engine — Media import from gallery, 4-corner projective warp, basic mesh warp (4x4 grid), polygon masking, brush masking, undo/redo system. All transforms output correctly to external display.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Import 1080p photo and video, warp each, see result on projector within 10 seconds of import
- 4-corner warp: drag any corner, preview updates at 60 fps, output matches preview
- Mesh warp (16 control points): drag points smoothly, no tearing, 60 fps
- Polygon mask: create 8+ vertex polygon, mask applies in real time
- Brush mask: paint mask at 60 fps with no visible latency

Description: Implement MediaImportService: launch ACTION_PICK/ACTION_GET_CONTENT intent for images and video. Handle content:// URI resolution, copy to app-local storage. Supported formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP (images), MP4 H.264, VP9 (video). Generate 256x256 thumbnail on import. Implement MediaSource abstraction with ImageSource and VideoSource both implementing IMediaSource. Handle Android scoped storage permissions (READ_MEDIA_IMAGES, READ_MEDIA_VIDEO for SDK 33+).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Supported formats load without crash
- Preview shows in canvas within 3 seconds
- Permission request with rationale dialog works correctly
- Thumbnails generated for project browser
- EXIF orientation handled (rotated images display correctly)
- Images > 4096x4096 downscaled on import

Description: Implement WarpMesh: subdivided quad mesh with configurable resolution. Implement FourCornerWarp with 4 draggable handles. Critical: implement projective texture mapping shader with homogeneous divide in fragment (uv = h.xy / h.w) for true perspective-correct sampling. Not bilinear vertex interpolation which produces bowtie distortion. Vertex positions in NativeArray<float3> for Burst compatibility.
Acceptance Criteria:
- No bowtie distortion on trapezoidal warps
- Corners snap accurately when dragged
- 60 fps during active corner dragging on mid-range device
- Handles visible as 20dp circles with highlight on active

Description: Implement MeshWarp: NxM grid of control points (default 4x4). Catmull-Rom or B-spline interpolation between control points for smooth deformation. Vertex buffer updated via Mesh.SetVertices with MeshUpdateFlags.DontRecalculateBounds. Draggable handles at each control point with guide lines and snap-to-grid option.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Smooth curves on irregular surfaces
- 16 control points all draggable simultaneously
- No mesh tearing with extreme deformation
- 60 fps during active mesh editing

Description: Implement MaskRenderer: renders to single-channel RT (R8 format). Mask RT multiplied with layer RT in composite shader. PolygonMask: tap to place vertices, double-tap/close to complete, ear-clipping triangulation, multiple polygons (additive/subtractive), invert mode. BrushMask: stamp-based rendering along touch path, adjustable radius (pinch) and hardness (slider), eraser mode (BlendOp RevSub). Both serializable for project save.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Masked areas transparent on output
- Polygon with 8+ vertices works correctly
- Brush mask paints at 60 fps with no visible latency
- Eraser mode removes mask cleanly
- Invert mode works correctly

Description: Implement undo/redo using Command pattern (ScriptableObject-based). Support warp changes, mask changes, drawing strokes. Ring buffer limited to 20 actions. Undo/redo buttons in toolbar with disabled state when stack empty.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Undo/redo works for all mapping operations
- Stack correctly limited to 20 actions
- Buttons reflect available actions

Description: Warp mode UI: show/hide control point handles, corner vs. mesh mode toggle. Mask mode UI: polygon tool, brush tool, radius slider, hardness slider, invert toggle, clear button. Tool switching: bottom bar highlights active tool, shows relevant sub-options. Import button: FAB or menu item launching gallery picker.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Tool switching feels intuitive
- Correct sub-options appear per tool
- All sliders responsive and correctly sized for touch

Summary: QA: Media import and mapping edge cases
Description: Test import with: tiny images (16x16), huge images (8K), corrupt files, DRM-protected video, various codecs, EXIF-rotated images. Test warp with: extreme corner positions, overlapping corners, very thin trapezoids, degenerate mesh triangles. Test mask with: complex polygons (50+ vertices), rapid brush painting. Memory profiling: import 10+ high-res images. Test on different aspect ratios (16:9, 20:9, foldables).
Acceptance Criteria:
- No crashes on any edge case input
- Graceful error messages for unsupported formats
- Memory stays under 512 MB with 10+ imported images
- All aspect ratios render correctly

Description: Phase 3: Creative Tools — Drawing and Effects — Fluid real-time drawing engine with pressure/velocity simulation, stroke smoothing with prediction buffer. 5-8 real-time GPU effects: kaleidoscope, tunnel, color cycle/morph, wave distortion, pixelate, edge glow, chromatic aberration, blur. Effect parameter UI with live preview. Effects apply per-layer before mixing.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Drawing feels fluid and responsive (< 20 ms touch-to-pixel latency) on mid-range devices
- Stroke rendering smooth (no visible segmentation) at fast swipe speeds
- Each effect runs at 60 fps individually on mid-range device
- 2 effects stacked per layer still maintains 60 fps
- Effect parameter changes preview in real time with no stutter

Summary: Fluid drawing engine with pressure/velocity simulation
Description: Implement DrawingCanvas: dedicated RenderTexture per layer. Stroke rendering pipeline: capture touch points via EnhancedTouch, fit Catmull-Rom spline (4-point window), adaptive subdivision, stamp brush texture with interpolated size/opacity. Size = base * pressure * velocity curve. Implement 1-2 frame prediction buffer for 60 Hz touch devices. Pressure simulation: velocity-based fallback (fast=thin, slow=thick). Soft round brush (Gaussian 64x64) and hard round brush. Use premultiplied alpha. Undo via RT snapshot ring buffer (20 states). Clear canvas and eraser tool.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Drawing feels natural on all test devices
- Pressure affects thickness/opacity correctly
- Prediction buffer reduces perceived latency on 60 Hz touch devices
- Samsung S Pen true pressure values preferred when available
- No dark fringing at stroke edges (premultiplied alpha)
- Undo ring buffer works without exceeding memory budget

Description: Implement EffectPipeline: ordered IEffect list per layer, ping-pong temp RTs, max 3 effects per layer. Effects via Shader Graph + hand-written fallback: (1) Kaleidoscope - polar UV modulo, params: segments 2-32, rotation, center. (2) Tunnel/Zoom - polar UV + animated radius. (3) Color Cycle - HSV hue shift over time. (4) Wave Distortion - sinusoidal UV displacement. (5) Pixelate - UV grid quantization. (6) Edge Glow - Sobel + color overlay. (7) Chromatic Aberration - RGB channel UV offset. (8) Blur - Dual Kawase (mobile-efficient). All shaders use half precision except UVs, minimize texture samples, avoid branching, use step/lerp.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All 8 effects run at 60 fps individually on mid-range device
- 2 effects stacked maintain 60 fps on mid-range
- Parameters update in real time with no stutter
- Shaders pass Mali Offline Compiler analysis without warnings
- All marked with UniversalPipeline render tag

Summary: Drawing toolbar and color picker UI
Description: Drawing toolbar: brush type selector, color picker (HSV wheel + recent colors strip), size slider (with preview circle), opacity slider. Color picker: compact HSV wheel expanding on tap, eye-dropper tool (tap canvas to sample color). All controls minimum 48dp touch targets.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Color picker responsive and intuitive
- Eye-dropper samples correctly from canvas
- Size preview circle updates in real time
- Recent colors strip shows last 8 used colors

Description: Scrollable grid of effect thumbnails with live-preview icons. Tap to add effect to current layer. Active effects show as cards with parameter sliders. Drag to reorder effects chain. Swipe to remove. Real-time preview: parameter changes apply immediately (no apply button).
Acceptance Criteria:
- User can browse, select, and tweak effects fluidly
- Effect chain order changeable by drag
- Removal via swipe gesture works
- All parameter changes preview instantly

Description: Drawing latency measurement via high-speed camera. Effect performance profiling: solo and combinations (2x, 3x stacked). Test drawing with: stylus (Samsung S Pen), finger, fast swipes, slow strokes, multi-touch. Test effects with: 4K source, video source, extreme parameter values. Memory profiling: undo stack with 20 drawing states.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Latency measurements documented per device
- Performance numbers for all effect combinations
- No crashes with extreme parameter values
- Undo stack memory under budget

Description: Phase 4: Layers, Mixing and Performance — Two independent layers (A/B), each with own media, warp, mask, drawing, effects. Live crossfade slider with multiple blend modes. Layer solo/mute/opacity. Performance optimization: shader variant stripping, GC elimination, adaptive quality system with user-visible Performance Mode toggle.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Both layers active with media + 1 effect each: 60 fps on mid-range device
- Crossfade slider produces smooth, real-time blend with no stutter
- Memory usage under 512 MB total with both layers fully loaded
- No GC spikes > 2 ms during mixing operations
- Adaptive quality degrades gracefully

Description: Implement LayerManager: manages two Layer instances (A and B). Each Layer owns: MediaSource, WarpMesh, MaskRenderer, DrawingCanvas, EffectPipeline, RenderTexture outputRT. Rendering is sequential: Layer A -> Layer B -> mix -> composite -> external display. Layer controls: solo, mute, opacity (per-layer alpha multiplier).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Layers independently configurable
- Layers can be swapped and opacity controlled
- Solo/mute work correctly
- Layer with no content renders as transparent (not black)

Description: Implement LayerMixer: crossfade output = lerp(layerA, layerB, mixValue). Blend modes via custom shader using MaterialPropertyBlock: Normal, Additive, Multiply, Screen, Overlay, Difference. Blend mode and mix value controlled by UI slider + mode picker. Single blit pass.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Smooth transitions between layers
- All 6 blend modes look correct
- Crossfade slider responsive at 60 fps
- Blend with fully transparent layer has no visual artifact

Summary: Implement adaptive quality system with Performance Mode
Description: Monitor frame time via FrameTimingManager. If > 14 ms for 10 consecutive frames: (1) reduce effect quality, (2) reduce composite RT resolution (75% -> 50%), (3) disable least-recently-added effect. Step back up when < 10 ms for 30 frames. Implement GPU capability tiers: Tier 1 (flagship) full quality, Tier 2 (mid-range) 75% RT, Tier 3 (low-end) 50% RT. User toggle in Settings: Performance Mode (forces Tier 2) vs Quality Mode (full, adaptive). Default to Quality Mode on first launch, persist in PlayerPrefs. Show toast on first switch: 'Performance Mode enabled - ideal for live shows'.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Sustained 60 fps on mid-range during dual-layer + effects
- Adaptive quality kicks in before visible frame drops
- Performance Mode toggle works and persists across launches
- Toast appears on first mode switch only

Summary: Performance optimization pass: GC elimination and shader stripping
Description: Shader variant stripping: audit URP variants, strip unused (fog, lightmaps). RenderTexture audit: ensure proper release, use GetTemporary/ReleaseTemporary. Draw call optimization: batch UI, MaterialPropertyBlock, minimize material switches. GC elimination: audit per-frame allocations, StringBuilder/Span<char>, NativeArray/NativeList, cache component refs, stackalloc for small arrays. GPU profiling: Mali Offline Compiler / Adreno GPU Profiler.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Zero per-frame GC allocations on hot paths
- Shader build size reduced by >= 30 MB
- No RT leaks after 30-minute run
- GPU profiling report for all target GPUs

Summary: Layer panel and crossfade mixer UI
Description: Layer panel (right drawer): two layer cards with thumbnail preview, media name, effect badges, solo/mute/opacity controls. Tap to select active layer. Crossfade slider: horizontal at bottom of canvas, large thumb. Blend mode picker: dropdown on mixer slider. Performance indicator: subtle colored dot (green/yellow/red) in status bar.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Layer panel intuitive and responsive
- Crossfade slider thumb easy to grab
- Active layer clearly indicated
- Performance dot updates in real time

Description: Performance test matrix: all combinations of (no media/image/video) x (no effects/1/2 effects) x (no drawing/drawing) across both layers. Memory leak test: 30-minute continuous layer switching. Crossfade smoothness: continuous slider for 60 seconds. Test on Snapdragon 695 class: verify adaptive quality kicks in. Test dual video decode: verify fallback when only 1 decoder available.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All performance combinations documented
- No memory leaks after 30 minutes
- Crossfade maintains 60 fps during continuous use
- Adaptive quality verified on low-tier device

Description: Phase 5: Import/Export and Project System — Project save/load (all settings, warp state, masks, drawings, media references, effect configs). Project browser with thumbnails and metadata. Video clip export (MP4) and screenshot export (PNG). Auto-save every 60 seconds without frame drop.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Save and reload complex project with perfect fidelity
- Project browser shows all saved projects with thumbnails
- Export 10-second 1080p MP4 in under 30 seconds on mid-range device
- Auto-save triggers every 60 seconds without frame drop

Description: Define ProjectData JSON schema (version, name, timestamps, resolution, layers with media/warp/mask/drawing/effects, mixer state). Implement ProjectManager: SaveProject (serialize to JSON, save drawing RTs as PNG, copy media, capture thumbnail), LoadProject, DeleteProject, ListProjects. Projects in Application.persistentDataPath/Projects/{guid}/. Auto-save: timer-based (60s) + event-based, .autosave subfolder, rotate last 3. Non-blocking: JSON on main thread, textures on background thread. Note: Texture2D.EncodeToPNG() must run on main thread via coroutine.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Projects save and load with perfect fidelity (pixel-level comparison)
- Auto-save at 60-second intervals without frame drop
- 256x256 thumbnails generated for browser
- Corrupt project JSON shows error, does not crash
- Missing media shows placeholder, does not crash

Description: Implement ExportService. Screenshot: ReadPixels from composite RT, EncodeToPNG, save to gallery via MediaStore API. Video export: Use Unity Recorder (free in 6.x) for dev prototyping; switch to custom AsyncGPUReadback + Android MediaCodec (H.264 hardware encoder) + MediaMuxer pipeline for release (avoids Recorder watermark/license issues). Target: 1080p @ 30 fps. Progress bar with cancel. Save to Movies/Maptifier/ via MediaStore. Note: AsyncGPUReadback has 2-3 frame latency; buffer frames. Fallback to ReadPixels on GLES devices without AsyncGPUReadback support.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Export 10s clip at 1080p 30fps in under 30 seconds
- Screenshot saves to gallery correctly
- Progress bar shows and cancel works
- Export captures composite output, not phone preview
- Works on both Vulkan and GLES devices

Description: Grid of project cards (thumbnail + name + last modified). Create new project button (prominent). Long-press for delete/duplicate/rename context menu. Search/filter when 10+ projects. Sort by last modified (default).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Intuitive project management
- All CRUD operations work
- Search filters correctly
- Empty state handled gracefully

Summary: QA: Save/load and export edge cases
Description: Test save/load roundtrip fidelity (pixel comparison). Test corrupt JSON handling. Test export with limited storage. Test auto-save during heavy rendering. Test missing media files after import. Test project from different aspect ratio device. Test storage full during save.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All edge cases handled without crash
- Graceful error messages for all failure modes
- Auto-save does not cause frame drops
- Cross-device project loading handles aspect ratio differences

Description: Phase 6: Polish, UI/UX and Onboarding — Onboarding flow (first-launch tutorial), UI animations and transitions, haptic feedback, settings screen, 3-5 template projects, app icon and splash screen, Firebase Analytics integration.
Acceptance Criteria:
- New user completes onboarding and creates first projection in under 3 minutes
- All UI transitions smooth (no jank)
- Settings changes apply immediately without restart
- Template projects load correctly on all test devices
- Splash screen displays correctly on all screen sizes

Description: 4-5 screen onboarding: (1) Welcome + branding with logo animation, (2) Connect your projector with cable illustration and detection, (3) Import or draw quick demo, (4) Warp to fit with corner-drag animation, (5) You're ready with create first project. Implement with UI Toolkit, swipe-to-advance, skip button. Coach marks: contextual tooltips on first use of each tool.
Acceptance Criteria:
- New users complete onboarding in under 3 minutes
- Skip button available on all screens
- Coach marks appear on first tool use
- Onboarding detects if projector already connected

Description: Panel slide-in/out animations (200 ms ease-in-out). Tool switch transitions. Button press feedback (scale 95% + haptic). Toast notifications (slide up, auto-dismiss 3s). Haptic: use Android VibrationEffect.createOneShot(10, 128) via native plugin for subtle taps (not Handheld.Vibrate which is too crude).
Acceptance Criteria:
- All transitions smooth at 60 fps
- Haptic feedback subtle and appropriate
- No animation jank during heavy rendering
- App feels premium and responsive

Description: Display section: resolution override, force display mode. Performance section: Quality/Balanced/Performance mode toggle. Drawing section: default brush size, pressure sensitivity curve. About section: version, licenses, feedback link. Dark theme with all states styled (pressed, disabled, focused).
Acceptance Criteria:
- All settings apply immediately without restart
- Settings persist across app launches
- Performance mode toggle works with toast on first switch

Description: Create 3-5 template projects: Geometric Pulse (kaleidoscope + mesh warp), Holiday Lights (color cycle + 4-corner), Abstract Flow (wave distortion + drawing), Logo Spotlight (tunnel + edge glow). Store as Addressable assets. Generate template thumbnails for project browser.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Templates load and render correctly on all test devices
- Thumbnails show in project browser
- Users can modify templates and save as new project

Summary: Splash screen, app icon, and analytics
Description: Implement splash screen with custom animated logo (1.5s max). Finalize adaptive icon set from Maptifier #1. Implement AnalyticsService (Firebase): events for app_open, project_created, project_loaded, media_imported, display_connected, export_completed, effect_applied, session_duration. No PII, GDPR consent dialog if EU distribution.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Splash displays correctly on all screen sizes
- App icon looks correct as adaptive and legacy
- Analytics events fire correctly in release build
- No PII collected

Summary: QA: Onboarding usability and UI polish testing
Description: Onboarding usability test: 3+ non-technical users, record success rate and pain points. UI accessibility audit: contrast ratios >= 4.5:1 (WCAG AA), touch targets >= 48dp. Test all UI states: empty, error, loading, overflow text. Test templates on all devices.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Usability test results documented
- All contrast ratios meet WCAG AA
- All touch targets >= 48dp
- No broken UI states

Description: Phase 7: Testing, Optimization and Device Certification — Full test pass on 10+ devices across 3+ OEMs. Performance optimization for 60 fps on all targets. Crash-free rate > 99.5%. Memory under 512 MB. Battery optimization. Wireless display fallback. Thermal throttling testing under stage-like conditions.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All target devices sustain 60 fps with dual layers + 1 effect each
- No ANR in 100 test sessions
- Cold start under 3 seconds on mid-range
- Video export works on all tested devices
- Zero critical bugs, under 5 major bugs remaining

Description: Execute full test plan on: Samsung Galaxy S23/S24, Galaxy A54/A55, Pixel 7a/8a, Xiaomi Redmi Note 12/13 Pro, OnePlus Nord 3/4, Galaxy Tab S9. Test categories: Functional (every feature), Performance (fps, memory, battery, thermal), Stress (30-min continuous use, rapid switching, 10+ saves), Edge (airplane mode, low storage, low battery, TalkBack, split-screen), External display (every device + adapter), Lifecycle (home, recent apps, phone call, notification, rotation). Thermal throttling: 30-minute dual-layer + effects in 30-35C ambient simulating stage lights.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Test report for every device/feature combination
- All target devices pass performance thresholds
- Thermal test shows no crash or sub-30fps drop
- All lifecycle scenarios handled gracefully

Description: Profile every device using Unity Profiler, FrameTimingManager, Android GPU Inspector (Adreno) / ARM Streamline (Mali). Optimize: Adreno (half precision, avoid dependent texture reads, Vulkan), Mali (minimize fragment complexity, avoid discard), PowerVR (tile-based compatibility). Implement GPU capability tiers: Tier 1 full, Tier 2 75% RT, Tier 3 50% RT. Detect via SystemInfo on first launch.
Acceptance Criteria:
- All target devices meet 60 fps target
- Per-device profiling reports completed
- GPU tiers correctly detected and applied
- Shader analysis clean on Mali Offline Compiler

Description: Implement Miracast/Google Cast detection via MediaRouter API. Cast composite RT as media route. Known limitation: Cast has 100-200 ms latency; show warning to user. Test on Chromecast, Miracast-compatible TV, Samsung Smart View.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Wireless display works as secondary option
- Latency warning shown to user
- Graceful fallback when wired unavailable

Description: Global exception handler: catch unhandled exceptions, log to Crashlytics, show recovery dialog. ANR watchdog: monitor main thread, log if approaching 5s threshold. Audit all async code for exception handling and cancellation. Test with Android 'Don't keep activities' enabled. Pre-warm critical shaders during splash to avoid first-launch compilation stutter (ShaderVariantCollection).
Acceptance Criteria:
- Crash-free rate > 99.5% in 100 sessions
- No ANR occurrences
- No first-launch shader stutter
- Recovery dialog works for unhandled exceptions

Description: Full regression pass after each optimization fix. Automated screenshot comparison for visual regression (capture composite output vs baseline). Verify no visual regressions from optimization changes.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Regression suite covers all features
- Visual comparison baseline established
- No regressions introduced by optimization

Description: Phase 8: Release Preparation and Store Assets — Signed release AAB, Play Store listing (screenshots, feature graphic, description), privacy policy, ProGuard/R8 rules, pre-launch report via Firebase Test Lab, launch checklist.
Acceptance Criteria:
- AAB passes Play Store pre-launch checks with no critical issues
- AAB size: base APK <= 95 MB + asset packs <= 40 MB (total <= 135 MB installed)
- All store assets meet Play Store requirements
- Privacy policy covers all data collection
- App rated Everyone on IARC content rating

Description: Configure release signing keystore (NOT in repo). ProGuard/R8 rules for Unity, Firebase, reflection-based code. Test release build thoroughly. Enable AAB + Play Asset Delivery for Addressables. Base APK target <= 95 MB, asset packs <= 40 MB. Version 1.0.0 / code 1. Final IL2CPP Release build with stripping. Use [Preserve] attribute / link.xml for reflection targets.
Acceptance Criteria:
- AAB builds and signs correctly
- Base APK <= 95 MB
- ProGuard/R8 does not break serialization or shader loading
- IL2CPP stripping does not remove needed code
